title: Countries with the fastest growing economies from 2001 to 2010
yAxis: Annual average GDP growth in percent
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Annual average GDP growth in percent for 10 number of Countrys.
The maximum Annual average GDP growth in percent 11.1 is found at Country Angola and the minimum is found at Rwanda where Country is 7.6.
The highest value at Country Angola is 1.46x times more than the lowest value at Rwanda.
min_summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Annual average GDP growth in percent in each Country on the y axis.
The Annual average GDP growth in percent is highest at Country Angola and lowest at Country Rwanda.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Annual average GDP growth in percent for 10 number of Countrys.

max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Annual average GDP growth in percent for 10 number of Countrys.
Country Angola has the highest Annual average GDP growth in percent and Rwanda has the lowest Annual average GDP growth in percent.
Second maximum Annual average GDP growth in percent is found at Country China.
The difference of Annual average GDP growth in percent between the highest and lowest Country is 3.5.
The Country Angola has the highest Annual average GDP growth in percent, followed by China, and Myanmar. Down to the Country Rwanda which is the lowest.
Country Chad, and Mozambique have a similar Annual average GDP growth in percent that is 7.9.
The Country Angola tends to be 1.25 percent higher than average.
Summing up the values of all Countrys, we get total 88.5.
